byline.original: By JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr. and NATE SCHWEBER

abstract: Defense and prosecution rest in trial of Pedro Hernandez, suspect accused of murdering 6-yar-old Etan Patz in 1979; Hernandez's fate rests heavily on whether he can be proved to have been mentally incompetent at time of crime.
lead_paragraph: After 10 weeks of testimony, both sides rested Thursday in the trial of Pedro Hernandez, the former store clerk charged with killing 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979.

headline.main: Suspect’s Mental Ability Is at Fore as Jurors in Patz Trial Prepare to Get Case
headline.print_headline: Suspect’s Mental Ability Is at Fore as Jurors in Patz Trial Prepare to Get Case

snippet: After 10 weeks of testimony, both sides rested Thursday in the trial of Pedro Hernandez, the former store clerk charged with killing 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979.
